pronunciation: VAIL, [Latin velum, from velo, to cover, to spread over. It is correctly written vail for e, in Latin, is our adjective ] [Latin velo.]

definitions.text:
1. Any kind of cloth which used intercepting the view and hiding something; as the of the temple among the Israelites.
2. piece of thin cloth silk stuff, used by females hide their faces. In some eastern countries, certain classes of females never appear abroad without vails.
3. cover; that which conceals; as the of oblivion.
4. In botany, the membranous covering of the germen the Musci and Hepaticae; the calypter.
5. Vails, money given servants. [Not used America.]VAIL,
To cover; hide the sight; as, the face.VAIL,

1. To let fall.They stiffly refused their bonnets.[I believe wholly obsolete.]
2. To let fall; lower; as, the topsail. obsolete
3. To let fall; sink. obsolete
To yield recede; give place; show respect by yielding.Thy convenience must thy neighbor's necessity. obsolete
